intro: Psilochenia runcinata subsp. andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's narrowleaf psilochenia, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
